intro: Rorippa lyrata, commonly known as the lyreleaf watercress, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in moist or aquatic environments, such as wetlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lyre-shaped, with a distinctive lobed structure, and it produces small, yellow flowers. Rorippa lyrata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
